fields.name: Adega Galegas Pazo la Maza Albariño, 2018
fields.friendly_name: Adega Galegas Pazo la Maza Albariño, 2018
fields.description: White Wine from Rias Baixas, Galicia, Spain. A textbook combination of delicate orchard fruits and citrus fragrances.

fields.name: Adega Galegas Veigadares Albariño, 2017
fields.description: White Wine from Rias, Baixas, Galicia, Spain. A complex but fruity and hugely refeshing Albariño with distinctive peach and soft fruit flavours.

fields.name: Domaine Vincent Dampt, Chablis, 2018
fields.description: White Wine from Chablis, Burgundy, France. A benchmark Chablis from one of the region's rising stars - flinty minerality and soft, creamy fruit.

fields.name: Cave de Ribeauville Pinot Blanc, 2019
fields.description: White Wine from Alsace, France. This cracker displays floral aromas with a rich, ripe and fruity fresh palate with waxy highlights, a medium body with a dry and nutty finish.

fields.name: Tenuta Campo di Sasso Sof Rosé, 2018
fields.friendly_name: Tenuta Campo di Sasso Sof Rosé, 2018
fields.description: Rosé Wine from Tuscany, Italy. A lifted nose with floral and fruity notes, a creamy palate in fine balance with a refreshing acidity and a clean, lingering finish.

fields.name: Chateau Tour de L'Evêque Rosé, 2019
fields.description: Rosé Wine from Provence, France. Vivacious red berry fruit, ripe nectarine and hints of sweet grapefruit. with a silky texture, delicate creaminess and vivid fruit.

fields.name: Domaine Tissier Sancerre Rosé, 2018
fields.description: Rosé Wine from Loire Valley, France. With a beautiful bright pink colour, succulent wild strawberry fruit and refreshing acidity, this succulent, strawberry-scented rosé is a must!

fields.name: Domaine François Crochet Sancerre Rosé, 2019
fields.description: Rosé Wine from Loire Valley, France. Pale Salmon pink colour, very fine notes of fresh red fruits on the nose which continues onto the well balanced palate.

fields.name: Quinta de Chocapalha Cabernet Sauvignon, 2017
fields.description: Red Wine from Lisboa, Portugal. This is deeply coloured and offers an overtly savoury nose, smoky notes complementing a wealth of red and black fruits. Majestic!

fields.name: Chateau Dutruch Grand Poujeaux, 2012
fields.description: Red Wine from Moulis, Bordeaux, France. Deep ruby-garnet, this offers a berried nose and flashes of dark chocolate and mocha. Ripe brambles on the palate with violet, herbs and spice.

fields.name: Crocus L'Atelier, 2014
fields.description: Red Wine from Cahors, France. Nearly opaque wine with purple tints. A bright and harmonious nose redolent of Morello cherries, with figs, redcurrants and raspberries to boot.

fields.name: Hyde de Villaine Belle Cousine, 2016
fields.description: Red Wine from Carneros, California, USA. Black and red currants emerge as hints of sweet, dry basil and black pepper. Powerful, concentrated, yet elegant.

fields.name: Achaval-Ferrer Quimera, 2015
fields.description: Red Wine from Mendoza, Argentina. Beautifully textured, opulent and supple, this dances on the palate - fresh and perfumed with rose and violet vying with hints of mocha.
